intro: Croptilon hookerianum var. validum, commonly known as the Hooker's croptilon, is a rare and distinctive plant species native to the alpine regions of the Himalayas. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from pale yellow to white. The plant's leaves are typically narrow and covered in a fine layer of silky hairs, which helps to reduce water loss in its harsh environment. It thrives in high-altitude meadows where the climate is cool and the soil is well-drained. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
